title: Weight Loss
question_text: Suppose a researcher wants to determine if a new weight loss drug is effective. She has $100\text{ volunteer subjects}$ . Which would be an appropriate method to determine the drug's effectiveness?

choices.text: Have all 100 100 of the subjects take the weight loss drug for three weeks and measure mean weight loss.
Give all 100 subjects 100 subjects the weight loss drug for three weeks, then no treatment for three weeks, and measure the differences in weight of the subjects both on the drug and off the drug.
Give half of the volunteers the new weight loss drug and the other half a placebo, then compare changes in weight between the two groups.
Draw subjects’ names out of a hat at random, giving the first 50 50 the new weight loss drug and the remaining 50 50 no treatment, then compare changes in weight between the two groups.
Draw subjects’ names out of a hat at random, giving the first 50 50 the new weight loss drug and the remaining 50 50 a placebo, then compare changes in weight between the two groups.
